title: Missing polyfill in IE with 15.2.3
body:
Using 15.2.3 and getting this error in IE11:

```
TypeError: Object doesn't support property or method 'from' at _toConsumableArray (https://hcp.betteroutcomes.com/static/patient/javascripts/bundle.js:28088:170) at renderElement (https://hcp.betteroutcomes.com/static/patient/javascripts/bundle.js:28163:10) at render (https://hcp.betteroutcomes.com/static/patient/javascripts/bundle.js:28128:10) at ReactCompositeComponentMixin._renderValidatedComponentWithoutOwnerOrContext (https://hcp.betteroutcomes.com/static/patient/javascripts/bundle.js:14485:6) at ReactCompositeComponentMixin._renderValidatedComponent (https://hcp.betteroutcomes.com/static/patient/javascripts/bundle.js:14511:8) at ReactCompositeComponentMixin.performInitialMount (https://hcp.betteroutcomes.com/static/patient/javascripts/bundle.js:14053:8) at ReactCompositeComponentMixin.mountComponent (https://hcp.betteroutcomes.com/static/patient/javascripts/bundle.js:13941:8) at ReactReconciler.mountComponent (https://hcp.betteroutcomes.com/static/patient/javascripts/bundle.js:6940:6) at ReactMultiChild.Mixin.mountChildren (https://hcp.betteroutcomes.com/static/patient/javascripts/bundle.js:13086:12) at ReactDOMComponent.Mixin._createInitialChildren (https://hcp.betteroutcomes.com/static/patient/javascripts/bundle.js:10117:10)
```

Offending line:

```
function _toConsumableArray(arr) { if (Array.isArray(arr)) { for (var i = 0, arr2 = Array(arr.length); i < arr.length; i++) { arr2[i] = arr[i]; } return arr2; } else { return Array.from(arr); } }
```

Adding 

```
require("babel-polyfill")
```

(as suggested here http://stackoverflow.com/questions/36622505/typescript-array-from-in-ie11) seems to fix the problem.

I believe this issue was introduced in moving from 0.14.3 to 15.2.3 but I have not reverted to the older React to verify this.

Shouldn't React itself include this polyfill ?
